page.title: 17 A VISIT TO A STUD FARM
page.content: On the 19th.June 1985 we went to a stud farm to ask some questions about the farm and the horses. On the farm there were about 120 horses and 60 foals. There were also some dogs,ferrets and chickens. We asked the farmer what she grew in her fields and she told us that she only grew grass and hay in the summer whch she harvested so that she could feed the animals in the winter. The farmer said she used to train horses to race-some in the Grand National-and that she had some of the Queen's horses here as well as some belonging to other members of the Royal Family.Prince Charles and Princess Anne own horses here.We were very surprised about this as we often pass the farm but had no idea about the owners until the day of our visit.
